contentrichtext.text: {{dablink|This article is about the former town in Okayama Prefecture, Japan. For other uses including other places with this name, see [[Kawakami]].}} {{nihongo|'''Kawakami'''|川上町|Kawakami-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in the former [[Kawakami District, Okayama|Kawakami District]], [[Okayama Prefecture|Okayama]], [[Japan]]. On October 1, 2004 Kawakami, along with the town of [[Ukan, Okayama|Ukan]], from [[Jōbō District, Okayama|Jōbō District]], and the towns of [[Bitchū, Okayama|Bitchū]] and [[Nariwa, Okayama|Nariwa]], all from [[Kawakami District, Okayama|Kawakami District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Takahashi, Okayama|Takahashi]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipality of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 3,853 and a [[population density|density]] of 44.33 persons per km². The total area was 86.91 km². ==External links== *[http://www.city.takahashi.okayama.jp/ Official website of Takahashi] in Japanese [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Okayama Prefecture]] {{Okayama-geo-stub}}
